result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Luis Alberto Perez-Fuentes

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Luis Alberto Perez-Fuentes not in court, in custody.  Attorney Theodore C. Seraphim appeared by video for Luis Alberto Perez-Fuentes.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel requests an additional scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Luis Alberto Perez-Fuentes not in court, in custody.  Attorney Theodore C. Seraphim in court for Luis Alberto Perez-Fuentes.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
MATTER HEARD OFF THE RECORD. Defense counsel has an offer but needs discovery from the State and requests a scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 088055,
Payable Number: 1032326,
Receipt Number: 22RP037036,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered no contact with BGG (DOB 7/8/93), AYP (DOB 2/4/13); LEP (DOB 7/11/14); and MNP (DOB 2/13/16)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Sworn as interpreter:  Kelley D. Salas

Defendant Luis Alberto Perez-Fuentes appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs appeared by video for Luis Alberto Perez-Fuentes. Student Intern Kevin Clancy under the supervision of Assistant District Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
